intro: Stephanomeria spinosa, commonly known as the spiked stephanomeria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant features spiny, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Its adaptability to arid conditions makes it a hardy and resilient species.
